channel.title: A few general questions
channel.description:
1. what program/how do i open .cfg files if my comp cant read them
2. a brief definition of a compiler,what it does, if its important
3.i just got a server online and my friend got the client where i got it(under server downloads) and he lags like crazy. is it his computer or the client (i dont lag at all)
I just been able to make a server, so i dont really know alot about whats going on.
thanks

item.title: A few general questions
item.dc:creator: @Projext Projext
item.description:
@Projext wrote:

[quote=“hyphy ftw, post:3, topic:316357”][quote author=new2servers link=topic=412920.msg3042374#msg3042374 date=1259207468]

  1. what program/how do i open .cfg files if my comp cant read them

  2. a brief definition of a compiler,what it does, if its important

3.i just got a server online and my friend got the client where i got it(under server downloads)
and he lags like crazy. is it his computer or the client (i dont lag at all)

I just been able to make a server, so i dont really know alot about whats going on.

thanks
[/quote]

  1. Right click the folder and go open with -> Notepad
  2. A compiler saves/sets the new changes you have made to client.java etc…
  3. Your mate nor your client is lagging, Its your computer that isnt good enough to host it, You computer must be a little old or you are using a project-Ceaser (however you spell it) based source (which can be also lagging him).[/quote]
    It’s not just his computer that can’t handle the server. It could also be his internet connection you know

Read full topic

item.title: A few general questions
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

1: Notepad to edit CFG files.
2: A compiler converts Java source code into Java bytecode which is then executed by the Java Virtual Machine.
3: Same as the guy above.

Read full topic

item.title: A few general questions

item.description:

[quote=“new2servers, post:1, topic:316357”]1. what program/how do i open .cfg files if my comp cant read them

  1. a brief definition of a compiler,what it does, if its important

3.i just got a server online and my friend got the client where i got it(under server downloads)
and he lags like crazy. is it his computer or the client (i dont lag at all)

I just been able to make a server, so i dont really know alot about whats going on.

thanks[/quote]

  1. Right click the folder and go open with -> Notepad
  2. A compiler saves/sets the new changes you have made to client.java etc…
  3. Your mate nor your client is lagging, Its your computer that isnt good enough to host it, You computer must be a little old or you are using a project-Ceaser (however you spell it) based source (which can be also lagging him).
